intro: Thouvenotia, commonly known as the rock cress, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Brassicaceae. It is characterized by its small, herbaceous growth habit and is typically found in rocky or arid environments. The plants usually have basal leaves that are linear to lanceolate in shape. Thouvenotia species produce small, white or yellow flowers arranged in racemes. They are often used in rock gardens due to their hardy nature and ornamental value.
